title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 151.1 - Equipment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 151.1 - Equipment

State Regulations

Every float navigated on the canal shall be properly
staffed and equipped and shall comply with all applicable provisions of the New

York State Navigation Law. Additionally, each float shall have bow and stern
lines, and fenders securely fastened to the float to prevent the float from
breaking concrete or damage to the lock and approach walls. Tires, hay bales, or other devices which in the opinion of the lock operator pose a risk to canal
equipment, are forbidden for use as fenders. Vinyl ball or cylindrical style
fenders are acceptable. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
151.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
